intro: Leiothrix obtusifolia, commonly known as the blunt-leaved leiothrix, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, ovate leaves with rounded tips and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
